To simplify the square root of 162, we can find the prime factors of 162 and then pair them up.

162 = 2 × 81
81 = 3 × 27
27 = 3 × 9
9 = 3 × 3

So, 162 = 2 × 3 × 3 × 3 × 3

Now, we can pair up the factors:

√162 = √(2 × 3 × 3 × 3 × 3) = √(2 × (3 × 3) × (3 × 3))

Since the square root of a product is the product of the square roots, we can rewrite this as:

√162 = √2 × √(3 × 3) × √(3 × 3)

Now, we can simplify the square roots of the perfect squares:

√162 = √2 × 3 × 3

√162 = 9√2

So, the simplified form of the square root of 162 is 9√2.
